title: Poetry Meter Quiz
description: Challenge yourself with questions about rhythm, meter, and the musical patterns found in poetry

questions.question: What is 'meter' in poetry?
options: The number of words in a line
The topic of a poem
The pattern of stressed and unstressed syllables in a line of verse
The rhyme scheme of a poem

questions.question: What is an 'iamb' in poetry?
options: Two unstressed syllables in a row
A stressed syllable followed by an unstressed syllable
An unstressed syllable followed by a stressed syllable
Two stressed syllables in a row

questions.question: What meter is most commonly used in Shakespeare's plays?
options: Iambic pentameter
Trochaic tetrameter
Dactylic hexameter
Anapestic trimeter

questions.question: How many metrical feet are in a line of 'pentameter'?
options: Five
Four
Six
Three

questions.question: What is a 'trochee'?
options: A stressed syllable followed by an unstressed syllable
Three syllables with stress on the first
Two unstressed syllables
An unstressed syllable followed by a stressed syllable

questions.question: The word 'GARDEN' (GAR-den) has the rhythm of which metrical foot?
options: Dactyl
Anapest
Iamb
Trochee

questions.question: What is a 'dactyl'?
options: Two stressed syllables in a row
A stressed syllable followed by two unstressed syllables
An unstressed syllable followed by a stressed syllable
Two unstressed syllables followed by a stressed one

questions.question: Homer's 'Iliad' and 'Odyssey' are written in which classical meter?
options: Trochaic tetrameter
Anapestic dimeter
Dactylic hexameter
Iambic pentameter

questions.question: What is an 'anapest'?
options: A stressed syllable followed by two unstressed syllables
Three stressed syllables in a row
A stressed syllable followed by an unstressed syllable
Two unstressed syllables followed by a stressed syllable

questions.question: What is 'free verse'?
options: Poetry written for free distribution
Poetry that follows strict iambic pentameter
Poetry with exactly ten syllables per line
Poetry that does not follow a regular meter or rhyme scheme

questions.question: How many metrical feet are in a line of 'tetrameter'?
options: Two
Three
Four
Five

questions.question: What is a 'spondee'?
options: A three-syllable foot with stress on the middle syllable
A single stressed syllable standing alone
A metrical foot consisting of two stressed syllables
A metrical foot consisting of two unstressed syllables

questions.question: What is 'scansion'?
options: The topic or subject of a poem
The process of translating a poem into another language
A type of rhyme scheme
The analysis of a poem's metrical patterns

questions.question: What is 'blank verse'?
options: Poetry that uses only one-syllable words
Poetry with no words
Poetry with no particular form
Unrhymed iambic pentameter

questions.question: What is 'enjambment' in poetry?
options: A type of rhyme
The continuation of a sentence beyond the end of a line without pause
The repetition of meter across stanzas
A complete stop at the end of a line
